attributes.action: The Electoral Commission should investigate Vote Leave
attributes.background: The Electoral Commission (EC) said “it would not be in the public interest to investigate” if Vote Leave broke the law (for a 2nd time) during the referendum. It also said that money obtained from crime might not make a political donation unlawful. An investigation is in the public interest.

rejection.details:
The Electoral Commission is independent of the Government and Parliament.

You can find out more here:

https://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/our-work/roles-and-responsibilities
